intro: Erigeron sulivani, commonly known as the Sulivani fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has silver-gray foliage that helps it retain moisture. Its flowers are typically white to pale blue, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Erigeron sulivani is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
